title: Material 1: Oxidation of Alcohols
content:
Alcohols can be oxidized to form aldehydes, ketones, or carboxylic acids. The oxidation product depends on the type of alcohol:

  • Primary alcohols (R-CH₂OH) oxidize to aldehydes (R-CHO) and further to carboxylic acids (R-COOH).
  • Secondary alcohols (R-CHOH-R) oxidize to ketones (R-CO-R).
  • Tertiary alcohols (R-C(OH)-R₂) do not undergo oxidation because they lack a hydrogen atom on the carbon bearing the hydroxyl (-OH) group.

Common oxidizing agents include:

  • Potassium dichromate (K₂Cr₂O₇) in acidic medium.
  • PCC (pyridinium chlorochromate), which is used to stop oxidation at the aldehyde stage.
